item.title:
@JonRWhitlock @bartulem @tucetombaz @ClaudiaBattist7 @Jingyi_GF @adric_dunn @KISNeuro Nice work!
@GordonPetty3 and I also saw movement-related signals in different thalamic nuclei that were independent of motor cortex and colliculus (https://t.co/09hr0irR6h). It would be interesting to try to decode a large set of movements from thalamic activity.
item.description:

It would be interesting to try to decode a large set of movements from thalamic activity.

item.title: @paqio I would expect broadening to be the same for both PSF sizes, kind of an additive effect. E.g., if the broading by scattering is 5 um, FWHMs could be 13 and 24 um - the relative broadening would be stronger for the smaller PSF. But I have no data on that, it's just my intuition.
item.description: @paqio I would expect broadening to be the same for both PSF sizes, kind of an additive effect. E.g., if the broading by scattering is 5 um, FWHMs could be 13 and 24 um - the relative broadening would be stronger for the smaller PSF. But I have no data on that, it's just my intuition.
item.content:encoded: @paqio I would expect broadening to be the same for both PSF sizes, kind of an additive effect. E.g., if the broading by scattering is 5 um, FWHMs could be 13 and 24 um - the relative broadening would be stronger for the smaller PSF. But I have no data on that, it's just my intuition.

item.title: In the IBL task, the prior probability that the stimulus appeared on the right switched in a random and uncued manner between 0.2 and 0.8 in blocks of trials. Mice leverage their prior knowledge of this block structure to improve their performance and obtain more rewards 🧀 (2/8) https://t.co/Zv7LAi7O1x

item.title: Two different modalities (electrophysiology and widefield imaging [WFI]), different mice but same task! item.title: This work provides a picture, at an unprecedented scale, of the neural processes underpinning prior information in decision-making, bringing evidence for the “Bayesian network” model of the brain. Check out our many more results in our preprint. (8/8) https://t.co/CpNxYPqBS8
